message.name: Get Voucher Details
message.purpose: The message GetVoucherDetails is used in order to obtain detailed information on an individual voucher.

request.comment: One of the elements serialNumber and activationCode must be present. In the case that both elements are present, an error will be returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: The serial number is included in the response when the request includes the activation code.

message.name: Get Voucher History
message.purpose: The message GetVoucherHistory is used to get historical information for a voucher including information about voucher state changes performed for a specific voucher.

request.comment: One of the elements serialNumber and activationCode must be present. In the case that both elements are present, an error will be returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Each transaction record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>

message.name: Update Voucher State
message.purpose: The message UpdateVoucherState is used to update the voucher state. The requested state change pointed out by the “newState” parameter must follow the state model with allowed state transitions defined for the voucher server.

request.comment: One of the elements serialNumber and activationCode must be present. In the case that both elements are present, an error will be returned.
The following state changes are available, see Table 11.
If oldState is omitted, the state change will be applied, no matter what state the voucher currently has, if the state change is supported.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Load Voucher Check
message.purpose:
The message LoadVoucherCheck is used to check if the vouchers in a serial number range are loaded into the database. The number of voucher found within the range are returned. If any voucher is missing, this is indicated in the response code, which is 10 (Voucher Does not exist), in that case. The requested serial number range is pointed out by serialNumberFirst and serialNumberLast.
Note: When using alphanumeric serial numbers (PC) the numberOfVouchers parameter will not always be correct. The use of message LoadVoucherCheck is not recommended for alphanumeric serial numbers (PC).

request.comment: serialNumberFirst and serialNumberLast must contain serial numbers of equal length.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Generate Voucher
message.purpose: The message GenerateVoucher is used to schedule a generate voucher task. The GenerateVoucher message will be added to the VS Task Manager for immediate or scheduled execution.

request.comment: A maximum of 1000000 vouchers may be generated at a time.
Not allowed when PC:10505 is active. The date will instead be generated from pre-configured values.
The schedulation record is a <struct> of its own.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Get Generate Voucher Task Info
message.purpose: The message GetGenerateVoucherTaskInfo is used to retrieve information about a GenerateVoucher task.

request.comment: Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>.

response.comment: Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: Will only be included if taskStatus is completed
failReason will be included if taskStatus is failed
The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task.

message.name: Load Voucher Batch File
message.purpose: The message LoadVoucherBatchFile is used to schedule the loading of a batch file. This message will be added to the task manager for immediate or scheduled execution.

request.comment: Valid states are available and unavailable.
If newState is omitted, the default value configured in VS will be used.
The schedulation record is a <struct> of its own.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Get Load Voucher Batch File Task Info
message.purpose: The message GetLoadVoucherBatchFileTaskInfo is used to retrieve information about a LoadVoucherBatchFile.

request.comment: If omitted all LoadVoucherBatchFile tasks are returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>.

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task

message.name: Get Voucher Batch Files List
message.purpose: The message GetVoucherBatchFilesList is used to get a list of all generated batch files. The filenames returned in the response are the names of the batchfiles that are used for loading vouchers in the LoadVoucherBatchFile tasks.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Each filename is enclosed within a <string> tag of its own. All filenames are placed in an <array>.

message.name: Change Voucher State
message.purpose:
The message ChangeVoucherState message is used to schedule a task to change the state of vouchers.
Caution! When using alphanumeric serial numbers (PC), range based operations are not recommended since it is likely to affect more vouchers than intended.

request.comment: One of the elements batchId, activationCode, serialNumber or a combination of serialNumberFirst and serialNumberLast must be present. In case two or more of the above elements are present (except for the combination of serialNumberFirst and serialNumberLast), an error will be returned.
The following state changes are valid: see Table 34
If oldState is omitted, the state change will be applied to all vouchers, within the specified range, where the operation is supported.
The scheduled record is a <struct> of its own, see Table 33.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Get Change Voucher State Task Info
message.purpose: The message GetChangeVoucherStateTaskInfo message is used to retrieve information about a ChangeVoucherState task.

request.comment: If omitted all ChangeVoucherState tasks are returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: The task record is enclosed in a <struct>. Structs are placed in an <array>, see Table 38.

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: Will only be included if taskStatus is completed.
failReason will be included if taskStatus is failed.
The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task

message.name: Purge Vouchers
message.purpose: The message PurgeVouchers is used to schedule a purge voucher task. The purge voucher task purges all voucher that match the specified criteria.

request.comment: One of the elements expiryDate and offset must be present. In the case that both elements are present, an error will be returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.
The schedulation record is a struct of its own, see Table 41.

struct.name: schedulation
struct.comment: If any recurrence is used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue must be present. This can only be used when offset is used for criteria.

message.name: Get Purge Vouchers Task Info
message.purpose: The message GetPurgeVouchersTaskInfo message is used to return information about a PurgeVoucherTask.

request.comment: If omitted all PurgeVouchers tasks is returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Task record. Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: Will only be included if taskStatus is completed
failReason will be included if taskStatus is failed
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task.

message.name: Generate Voucher Details Report
message.purpose: The GenerateVoucherDetailsReport message is used to schedule a report of all vouchers in a specified batch. For information of the report file, see Protocol Message Specification Voucher Details Report File, Reference [3].

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.
The schedulation record is a <struct> of its own

message.name: Get Generate Voucher Details Report Task Info
message.purpose: The GetGenerateVoucherDetailsReportTaskInfo message is used to return information about a GenerateVoucherDetailsReport Task.

request.comment: If omitted all GenerateVoucherDetails tasks are returned
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Task record. Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: The time zone part is always +0000.
Will only be included if taskStatus is completed.
failReason will be included if taskStatus is failed
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task

message.name: Generate Voucher Distribution Report
message.purpose:
The GenerateVoucherDistributionReport message is used to create a voucher distribution report either for a batch or for all vouchers in the database.
For information about the report file, see PMS Voucher Distribution Report File, Reference [4].

request.comment: If batchId is omitted all vouchers in the database will be included in the report.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.
The schedulation record is a <struct> of its own

struct.name: schedulation
struct.comment: If any recurrence is used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue must be present.
If any recurrence is used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue must be present.

message.name: Get Generate Voucher Distribution Report Task Info
message.purpose: The GetGenerateVoucherDistributionReportTaskInfo message is used to return information about a GenerateVoucherDistributionReport task.

request.comment: If omitted all GenerateVoucherDistributionReport tasks are returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: Will only be included if taskStatus is completed.
failReason will be included if taskStatus is failed
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task.

message.name: Generate Voucher Usage Report
message.purpose: The GenerateVoucherUsageReport message is used to schedule a report of all vouchers that was used within a specified time frame.

request.comment: If fromTime is omitted all vouchers up to the toTime will be included in the report.
If toTime is omitted all vouchers from the fromTime will be included in the report.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.
The schedulation record is a <struct> of its own

struct.name: schedulation
struct.comment: If any recurrence is used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue must be present.
If any recurrence is used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue must be present.

message.name: Get Generate Voucher Usage Report Task Info
message.purpose: The GetGenerateVoucherUsageReportTaskInfo message is used to return information about a specific or all GenerateVoucherUsageReport tasks.

request.comment: If omitted all GenerateVoucherUsageReport tasks is returned.
This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

response.comment: Each task record is enclosed in a <struct> of its own. Structs are placed in an <array>

struct.name: tasks
struct.comment: Will only be included if taskStatus is completed.
Will only be included if taskStatus is completed.
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
If any recurrence was used, both recurrence and recurrenceValue will be present.
The taskData record is a <struct> of its own. It contains the parameters used to create the task

struct.name: taskData
struct.comment: Time part of DateTime is always T00:00:00+0000.
Time part of DateTime is always T00:00:00+0000.

message.name: Delete Generate Voucher Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Delete Load Voucher Batch Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Delete Change Voucher State Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Delete Purge Voucher Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Delete Voucher Details Report Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Delete Voucher Distribution Report Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Delete Voucher Usage Report Task
message.purpose: The DeleteTask message is used to delete a task. There is one request for each type of task but the parameters and behavior are the same for all of them.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: Reserve Voucher
message.purpose: This message is used to reserve a voucher. The message represents the start of a refill transaction. The additionalAction parameter can be used to request different reservation mechanisms, and it controls the need of issuing specific commit or rollback messages.

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

message.name: End Reservation
message.purpose: This message is sent after a refill has been carried out. A successful refill will result in the transaction committing, and the voucher state is updated to "used". An unsuccessful refill will cause the refill transaction to be rolled back. The voucher status will then be reset to "available".

request.comment: This element is mandatory if Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality is activated; otherwise, the element is optional.

element.name: action
element.purpose: This flag is used on completion of the refill transaction. It indicates to the Voucher Server if the transaction should be committed or rolled back.

element.name: activationCode
element.purpose: The activationCode parameter is the unique secret code which is used to refill the account. The activation code may have leading zeros. The element size defined below defines the limit at protocol level, and may be further restricted at application level by the server side.

element.name: activationCodeLength
element.purpose: This flag can be used on reservation to automatically commit the voucher or to request automatic rollback of the voucher in case of no commit within a specified time.

element.name: additionalAction
element.value: Automatic Rollback of Transaction in case of no commit within specified time

element.name: additionalInfo
element.purpose: The additionalInfo parameter is used to hold additional information such as how many vouchers of a voucher batch file that was successfully loaded.

element.name: agent
element.purpose: The agent parameter is used to indicate the name of the dealer who has received the card from the service provider.

element.name: batchId
element.purpose: The batchId parameter indicates what batch a voucher belongs to. The batchId is assigned when vouchers are generated.

element.name: currency
element.purpose: The currency parameter is used to indicate the currency of the voucher value. The currency is expressed as a three letter string according to the ISO 4217 standard, see Codes for the representation of currencies and funds, Reference [6]. Examples are "EUR" for Euro and "SEK" for Swedish Kronor.

element.name: executionTime
element.purpose: The executionTime parameter is used to define the time when a task was run or should be run.

element.name: expiryDate
element.purpose:
The expiryDate parameter is used to identify the last date when the voucher will be usable in the system. Only the date information will be considered by this parameter. The time and timezone should be set to all zeroes, and will be ignored.
TZ is the deviation in hours from UTC. This field is optional. This date format does not strictly follow the XML-RPC specification on date format. It does however follow the ISO 8601 specification. Parsers for this protocol must be prepared to parse dates containing timezone.

element.name: extensionText1
element.purpose:
The extensionText1, extensionText2 and extensionText3 parameters are used to store any additional information connected to a voucher. The definition of the extension texts are site specific and have no special meaning within VS.
Note: Space is an allowed character.

element.name: extensionText2
element.purpose:
The extensionText1, extensionText2 and extensionText3 parameters are used to store any additional information connected to a voucher. The definition of the extension texts are site specific and have no special meaning within VS.
Note: Space is an allowed character.

element.name: extensionText3
element.purpose:
The extensionText1, extensionText2 and extensionText3 parameters are used to store any additional information connected to a voucher. The definition of the extension texts are site specific and have no special meaning within VS.
Note: Space is an allowed character.

element.name: failReason
element.purpose: The failReason parameter is used to describe the cause of a failed task in execution.

element.name: faultCode
element.purpose: The faultCode parameter is used to signify that a request failed due to illegal request data or internal processing errors. This does not cover business level logic faults, which instead are covered in the responseCode parameter, see Section 9.29 on page 73.
element.value: This fault code is reserved for future use

element.name: faultString
element.purpose: The faultString parameter is used to give a descriptive message as a complement to the faultCode parameter.

element.name: filename
element.purpose: The filename parameter is the filename generated as output from the specific operation. Note that the filename is not a complete filename. The full path of the file is not included and the suffix of the file may be excluded (for report files for example).

element.name: fromTime
element.purpose: The fromTime parameter together with toTime parameter is used to create a time frame, which can be used to define, for example a matching criteria. The fromTime parameter is used to determine which vouchers was used in a specific time frame.

element.name: newState
element.purpose: The newState parameter is used to represent the state of the voucher as it is, or will be, after a specific event. Such an event could be a request to change a voucher to the new state, or it could be a historical record that represents a state change in the past.

element.name: initialVoucherState
element.purpose: The initialVoucherState parameter is used to set which state the voucher will be in when a voucher is loaded (Voucher Load). A voucher can be set to the state available or unavailable. When performing the GetLoadVoucherBatchFileTaskInfo operation the name and which state the voucher is in will be presented. See Section 9.18.1 on page 67.
element.value: Voucher is loaded, but still unavailable for usage.
Voucher is loaded and available for usage.
Voucher was reserved, but never commited.

element.name: networkOperatorId
element.purpose: The networkOperatorId parameter is used to reference a Mobile Virtual Network Operator. The VS system is capable of administering and managing multiple operators simultaneously. Each Mobile Virtual Network Operator has its own database schema, in which this operator's own vouchers are stored. The parameter is bound to the Mobile Virtual Network Operator functionality, which must be explicitly configured. If not activated, the parameter is not mandatory, in which case all requests are targeted to the default database schema of the VS system.

element.name: numberOfVouchers
element.purpose: The numberOfVouchers parameter is used to define the number of vouchers in a batch or a serial number range.

element.name: offset
element.purpose: The offset parameter is used to indicate a date in the past, by specifying the offset, in days, from the current date. If this parameter is used in a scheduled request the offset will based on the time of execution rather than the current date.

element.name: oldState
element.purpose: The oldState parameter is used to represent the state of the voucher as it is, or was, prior to a specific event. Such an event could be a request to change a vouchers state from the specified state, or it could be a historical record that represents a state change in the past.
element.value: Voucher is loaded, but still unavailable for usage.
Voucher is loaded and available for usage.
Voucher was reserved, but never commited.

element.name: operatorId
element.purpose: The operatorId parameter is used to define the name of the operator who carried out the operation. When used in a response message it represents the operator that did the change on the voucher.

element.name: outputVAC
element.purpose: The outputVAC parameter is used to specify whether the Voucher Activation Code should be included in the report generated by a scheduled task.
element.value: The voucher activation code will not be included in the scheduled report.
The voucher activation code will be included in the scheduled report.

element.name: purgeVouchers
element.purpose: The purgeVouchers parameter is used to specify whether the vouchers should actually be purged by the PurgeVouchers scheduled task. The PurgeVouchers task will still generate a report even when the vouchers are not actually purged.

element.name: recurrence
element.purpose: The recurrence parameter is, in combination with the recurrenceValue parameter, used to define how often a scheduled task should be executed. This parameter indicates whether the recurrence is described in terms of days, weeks or months.

element.name: recurrenceValue
element.purpose: The recurrenceValue parameter is, in combination with the recurrence parameter, used to define how often a scheduled task should be executed. This parameter defines the interval of the recurrence.

element.name: reportFormat
element.purpose: The reportFormat parameter is used to determine what output format the result report file will have.
element.value: Both failed and successful changes are written

element.name: responseCode
element.purpose: The responseCode parameter is sent back after a message has been processed and indicates success or failure of the message.
element.value: Voucher already used by other subscriber
Voucher already used by same subscriber
This responseCode is reserved for future use
Subscriber Id mismatch between the reservation and the end of reservation
Transaction Id mismatch between messages between reservation and the end of reservation
Can not delete a running task

element.name: serialNumber
element.purpose: The serialNumber parameter is used to state the unique voucher serial number that is used to identify the voucher. Leading zeros are allowed. The element size defined below defines the limit at protocol level, and may be further restricted at application level by the server side.

element.name: serialNumberFirst
element.purpose: The serialNumberFirst parameter is used to state the first voucher in the serial number range to be checked. Leading zeros are allowed. The element size defined bellow defines the limit at protocol level, and may be further restricted at application level by the server side.

element.name: serialNumberLast
element.purpose: The serialNumberLast parameter states the last voucher in the serial number range to be checked. Leading zeros are allowed. The element size defined below defines the limit at protocol level, and may be further restricted at application level by the server side.

element.name: state
element.purpose: The state parameter is used to represent the state of a voucher, as it currently is.
element.value: Voucher is loaded, but still unavailable for usage.
Voucher is loaded and available for usage.
Voucher was reserved, but never committed.
Voucher expiryDate is older than purge expiryDate.

element.name: subscriberId
element.purpose: The subscriberId parameter is used to identify a subscriber in the system. This field will hold the phone number of the subscriber in the same format as held in the account database. The number is usually in national format. Leading zeroes are allowed.

element.name: taskId
element.purpose: The taskId parameter is used to state the unique Id that identifies a task in the VS Task Manager.

element.name: taskStatus
element.purpose: The taskStatus parameter is used to indicate in what state a task is in.
element.value: The task is scheduled for execution
The task have finished executing and was successful
The task have finished executing and was unsuccessful

element.name: timestamp
element.purpose: The timestamp parameter is detailing the time a voucher state change was done.

element.name: toTime
element.purpose: The toTime parameter together with the fromTime parameter is used to create an interval and within this time frame is the matching criteria. The toTime parameter is used to determine which vouchers was used in a specific time frame.

element.name: transactionId
element.purpose: The transactionId parameter should be unique among transactions, and it must be common among different requests within the same transaction.

element.name: value
element.purpose: The value parameter is used to specify the actual value of the voucher in currency units. The value is formatted as a numeric string. No decimal separator is included. The amount is expressed in the lowest denomination of the specified currency. For example a USD 100 value is represented as 10000.

element.name: voucherGroup
element.purpose: The voucherGroup parameter is used to define a set of properties that are associated with a voucher. Each voucher is assigned to a voucher group and many vouchers can be assigned the same voucher group.

element.name: voucherExpired
element.purpose: The voucherExpired parameter is used to indicate if the voucher has passed the expiration date. When this parameter is set the voucher can no longer be used. If the voucher is not expired this parameter will not be included.

element.name: supplierId
element.purpose: The supplierId parameter is used to indicate the supplier (print shop) for which voucher batch files with separate encryption keys per supplier will be generated.
